metadata.title: CVE-2023-52708 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mmc:mmc_spi: fix error handling in mmc_spi_probe() If mmc_add_host() fails, itdoesn't need to call mmc_remove_host(), or it will cause null-ptr-deref,because of deleting a not added device in mmc_remove_host(). To fix this,goto label 'fail_glue_init', if mmc_add_host() fails, and change the label'fail_add_host' to 'fail_gpiod_request'.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-aws - 5.4.0-1103.111~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1108.114~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1107-gcp - 5.4.0-1105.114~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1049.54~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-oracle - 5.4.0-1101.110~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1088-raspi - 5.4.0-1085.96~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
